titleInfo.title: Double exile : migrations of Jewish-Hungarian professionals through Germany to the United States, 1919-1945.

mods.abstract: Offers a social history of refugees escaping Hungary after the Bolshevik-type revolution of 1919, the ensuing counter revolution, and the rise of anti-Semitism. This book is based on extensive archival work in the USA and Germany.

subject.topic: Jewish Refugees -- United States -- Social conditions -- 20th century
Jews, Hungarian -- United States -- Social conditions -- 20th century
